About the job
Clinical Lead Statistician

(Utrecht, full-time)


Danone's mission is to bring health through food to as many people as possible. Are you passionate about life sciences research and life sciences data, ranging from pre-clinical biological data through to human early phase clinical trials through to food technology formulation? Do you get excited about working on the statistical aspects of the design and execution of clinical studies?

Your Mission: apply your statistical expertise within the Danone Nutricia Research & Innovation (R&I) Center by providing advice and support in the design, execution and interpretation of the statistical analysis of clinical research.
You will be a member of the Human Evidence Insight Generation team within the Advanced Health & Science division. This dynamic department is responsible for the statistical expertise in early-phase clinical studies. The Clinical Lead Statistician works in close collaboration with Data Management and Statistical Programming, as well as with clinical study team members and other stakeholders within Clinical Research, but also with stakeholders of other science centres within R&I. The teams work according to high scientific and operational standards.


About the job

Your primary responsibility will be to drive statistical expertise by providing state-of-the-art statistical advice and support in the design, execution, analysis, and interpretation of large-scale multidimensional clinical trial data.
Provide expert statistical input and advice into the key documents for clinical trials, specifically, but not limited to, statistical analysis plans and study protocols.
Conduct hands-on statistical analyses of clinical trial data, in close collaboration with statistical programmers.
Evaluate and improve internal statistical tools, methodologies and processes, based on the most recent developments in the scientific field.
Responsible for project management of the statistical part incl. timelines, deliverables and stakeholder management.
In addition, there is the opportunity to collaborate with and provide technical support to (pre)clinical and life science researchers, to deliver biostatistics analyses of datasets, validate key findings and suggest further experiments.
About you
About you

Master's degree (PhD would be a plus) in Statistics, Biostatistics or a related field with strong statistical content.
At least 5 years of experience with statistical models.
Programming experience with SAS or R/Python
An ability to translate scientific information into business insights.
A good understanding and ability to implement statistical techniques used in large-scale multidimensional and hierarchical data (e.g. linear/ logistic regression, high-throughput data analysis with univariate and multivariate models taking into account the complex correlation structure of the data, etc.)
Independent ability to maintain state-of-the-art statistics skills and implement and adapt new techniques for statistical analysis.
An active interest in undertaking scientific research and the ability to learn new techniques and apply them to a high standard.
Enthusiasm for and a desire to make a career in biostatistics.
Excellent communication skills (in English) to interact with a multidisciplinary project team at Danone Nutricia Research and with other parties involved, such as CROs.
Ability to explain statistics orally as well as in writing to non-statisticians.
Ability to work on various projects simultaneously.
Ability to work independently, efficiently, and precisely and take initiative.


Desirable

A solid understanding of biomedical research, clinical trials, and good clinical practice (GCP), drug/product development would be an advantage.
Pragmatic attitude and be adaptable to the changing needs of the business being agile and flexible.
About us
About us

Working here you’ll need to enjoy a fast-pace, complexity and it can get a little challenging. But it’s packed with opportunities. You’ll work with some of the best-known brands in the world, such as Evian, Nutricia, Activia and Nutrilon and we absolutely guarantee that you can just be yourself. Be innovative and entrepreneurial and the impact you could make might just amaze you. Join our movement for a healthier world. One Planet One Health BY YOU.


We are proud to be an equal employer. We are convinced our differences make the difference and that an inclusive working environment will drive our growth as a business, as teams and as individuals. We will therefore consider all applicants for employment* fostering an inclusive working culture that is accessible for all.


Did you know that as a B-Corp certified company, Danone Benelux meets the highest verified standards of social and environmental performance, transparency, and accountability?
